com.att.api.immn.service
Class IAMManager

java.lang.Object
  com.att.api.immn.service.IAMManager

public class IAMManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates AT&Ts REST APIs for In-App Messaging

Author:
dg185p, ps350r, sm095n

Constructor Detail

IAMManager

public IAMManager(java.lang.String fqdn,
                  OAuthToken token,
                  com.att.api.immn.listener.ATTIAMListener iamListener)
Creates an IAMManager object.

Parameters:
fqdn - fully qualified domain name to use for sending requests
token - OAuth token to use for authorization
iamListener - listener for callback
Method Detail

GetMessage

public void GetMessage(java.lang.String msgId)
The Message with the given identifier is retrieved from the background task The background task returns the response of the type Message to the listener

Parameters:
msgId - - A message identifier representing a Subscriber Message in the AT&T Messages environment.

SendMessage

public void SendMessage(java.lang.String[] addresses,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        boolean group,
                        java.lang.String[] attachments)
The background task returns the response of the type SendResponse to the listener

Parameters:
address - - Addresses can be in the following forms and at least one of them must be provided:
  • MSISDN This format is the mobile number based on North American Numbering Plan with a maximum length of 11 digits. It must be preceded by the following prefix: tel:
  • Valid formats are:
    • tel:+12012345678
    • tel:12012345678
    • tel:2012345678
    International numbers are not be supported.
  • Short code This format is a special number between 3-8 digits long. It must be preceded by the following prefix: short: Valid formats are:
    • short:123
    • short:12345678
  • Email address This format is the standard email address format. Validation of the address must be performed. A maximum of 10 addresses is supported. However, this limit can be configurable at a System level. If any of the addresses are duplicated, the message is sent to that address only once.
    message - - The Message to be sent.
    • If the request is detected to be MMS then the following character sets will be supported :
      • ASCII
      • UTF-8
      • UTF-16
      • ISO-8859-1
    • If the request is detected to be SMS then the following character set will be supported: ISO-8859-1 It becomes a mandatory field if Attachment(s) is NOT provided in the request.
    subject - - It is the header for the message.
    group - - If set to True, implies there are multiple recipients else message is treated as Broadcast.
    attachments - - String for the filename of the media content.

GetMessageContent

public void GetMessageContent(java.lang.String msgId,
                              java.lang.String partNumber)
The Application will request message content from the AT&T Systems by providing a content identifier and the associated message identifier. The content associated with the identifier provided in the request is returned. The background task returns the response of the type MessageContent to the listener

Parameters:
msgId - - A message identifier representing a Subscriber Message in the AT&T Messages environment.
partNumber - - A content identifier representing an attachment in the referenced subscriber message.

GetMessageList

public void GetMessageList(int limit,
                           int offset)
The Application will request a block of messages by providing count and an offset value. A list of messages is returned in received order starting with the most recent. The background task returns the response of the type MessageList to the listener

Parameters:
limit - - This parameter defines the upper limit of the number of returned messages. A maximum value of 500 is supported.
offset - - This parameter defines the offset from the beginning of the ordered set of messages.

GetDelta

public void GetDelta(java.lang.String state)
This provides capability to check for updates by passing in a client state. The background task returns the response of the type DeltaResponse to the listener

Parameters:
state - - This string is from a either the Get Message Index request, or from the Get Message List request.

GetMessageIndexInfo

public void GetMessageIndexInfo()
The GetMessageIndexInfo method gets the state, status, and message count of the index cache for the subscriber’s inbox. This method returns a response of the type MessageIndexInfo to the listener.

CreateMessageIndex

public void CreateMessageIndex()
The CreateMessageIndex method creats an index cache for the subscriber’s inbox. This method must be called before any of the other operations is used. In addition, if a message index is inactive for 30 or more days, then the developer will need to create an index cache again. The background task returns the response with either true or false for success or failure respectively to the listener

DeleteMessage

public void DeleteMessage(java.lang.String msgId)
This operation gives the the ability to delete a specific message in an inbox. The background task returns the response with either true or false for success or failure respectively to the listener

Parameters:
msgId - - Id of the message that is intended to get deleted

DeleteMessages

public void DeleteMessages(java.lang.String[] msgIds)
This operation gives the ability to delete messages in an inbox. The messageIds are passed in the query string in the request. The background task returns the response with either true or false for success or failure respectively to the listener

Parameters:
msgIds - - Comma delimited message ids.

UpdateMessages

public void UpdateMessages(com.att.api.immn.service.DeltaChange[] messages)
This allows to update the flags that are associated with a collection of messages. Any number of messages can be passed in. The background task returns the response with either true or false for success or failure respectively to the listener

Parameters:
messages - - Container for the messages and the flags that need updating

UpdateMessage

public void UpdateMessage(java.lang.String msgId,
                          java.lang.Boolean isUnread,
                          java.lang.Boolean isFavorite)
This allows to update the flags that are associated with a specific message. The developer passes in the messageId. The background task returns the response with either true or false for success or failure respectively to the listener

Parameters:
msgId - - Id of the message that is intended to get updated
isUnread - - optional - This flag provides capability to set a message unread or read status
isFavorite - - optional - Sets the message to favorite or to unset the favorite.

SetCurrentToken

public static void SetCurrentToken(com.att.api.oauth.OAuthToken token)
The SetCurrentToken method updates the current access token used for the subsequent API calls.

Parameters:
token - - Overrides the default OAuth token used for authorization.

SetLowerTokenExpiryTimeTo

public static void SetLowerTokenExpiryTimeTo(long value)
The SetLowerTokenExpiryTimeTo method updates the current value for the token expiry override time.

Parameters:
value - - Override expiry time in seconds.

GetLowerTokenExpiryTimeTo

public static long GetLowerTokenExpiryTimeTo()
The GetLowerTokenExpiryTimeTo method returns the current expiry time override value.

SetTokenUpdatedListener

public static void SetTokenUpdatedListener(com.att.api.immn.listener.AttSdkTokenUpdater listener)
The SetTokenUpdatedListener method updates the listener to call back when the access token is updated.

Parameters:
listener - - AttSdkTokenUpdater object.

isCurrentTokenExpired

public static java.lang.Boolean isCurrentTokenExpired()
The isCurrentTokenExpired method checks if the current access token is expired.

SetApiFqdn

public static void SetApiFqdn(java.lang.String fqdn)
The SetApiFqdn method updates the FQDN of the AT&T API end point.

Parameters:
fqdn - - fully qualified domain name e.g. https://api.att.com

CheckAndRefreshExpiredTokenAsync

public java.lang.Boolean CheckAndRefreshExpiredTokenAsync()
The CheckAndRefreshExpiredTokenAsync method automatically updates the current token using the RefreshToken.

RevokeToken

public void RevokeToken(java.lang.String hint)
The RevokeToken method revokes the current token.

Parameters:
hint - a hint for the type of token to revoke

RevokeAccessToken

public void RevokeAccessToken()
The RevokeAccessToken method revokes the access token.
